question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Every 5 months, Hal has to replace the batteries in his calculator. He changed them the first time in May. In what month will they be changed the 25th time?
inference:
Hal changes the batteries every 5 months. Therefore, he changes them \(25 \times 5 = 125\) months from the first time. May is the fifth month of the year. Therefore, he changes them 125 - 5 = 120 months later, which is 10 years. Therefore, he changes them in May of the eleventh year from the first time.
Final Answer: \boxed{May}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: If the first time was in May, the second time will be 5 months after May, the third time will be $5\cdot2$ months after May, etc. That means the 25th time will be $5\cdot24$ months away. Since the months repeat every 12 months, we look for the remainder when $5\cdot24$ is divided by 12 and add that many months to May. We notice that $\frac{5\cdot24}{12}=5\cdot2$, so it turns out that $5\cdot24$ is a multiple of 12 and leaves a remainder of 0 when divided by 12. So the 25th time will be a certain number of years afterward but still in the same month, $\boxed{\text{May}}$.
